title: Display font
content:
Looking for the lock, stock & barrel font, or something similar.

Font: 

 Billhead and Copperplate 

Solved By: 

 [kthomps5](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131310/http:/typophile.com/user/175823 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [image.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131310/http:/typophile.com/files/image_243.jpg) | 102.69 KB |
author: pacedesign

comments.content:
The |L|, |S|, and |B| are Billhead 1910, by Letterhead fonts:  
 [http://www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/billhead.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131310/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/billhead.php "http://www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/billhead.php")

The balance of the name appears to be some variation of Copperplate (the ampersand is similar to the one found in Engraver’s Gothic).
Kevin is right on the money. That's a full use of Billhead: **1910** for initials /L, /S and /B and **1900** for the rest of the lettering
Thanks, as always... Right on the "money"!
